item.title: Metaphor: ReFantazio - All Neuras Relic Locations
item.description:
Maximizing the follower bond rank with Neuras in Metaphor: ReFantazio requires a significant amount of legwork, as it tasks players with retrieving relics for him. Each relic search is tied to either a quest or a bounty, which sends off the protagonist to visit some new and familiar locations.

After finally coming across the relic, returning it to Neuras will level up the follower's bond with him, but with so many needing to be found, acquiring them all can prove difficult. For those struggling to complete this task, here's where to find all the relics for Neuras in Metaphor: ReFantazio .

All Neuras Relic Locations In Metaphor: ReFantazio

There are 8 relics that players must find for Neuras to rank up his follower bond in Metaphor: ReFantazio . Players can start their bond with Neuras after the date 06/14 following talking to him on the Gauntlet Runner. After this, you need to keep completing side quests and bounties and retrieve all the relics for Neuras.

Here's a rundown on all the relics players are required to retrieve for Neuras in Metaphor: ReFantazio .

Side Quest

Relic's Name & Requirement

Relic's Location

How To Get the Relic

Providing a Spark

Glass Ornament and Inventor's Journal

Komero Town outside Martira

  1. Start the 'Hatching a Plan' side quest from Gloomy Youth in Thoroughfare Square Martira to unlock Komero Village.
  2. Complete the quest and return the items to Neuras to start a bond with him.

Relic Search - Inventor's Bequest

Screwed-Up Mineral

Man-Eater's Grotto

  1. Start the Man-Eater in the Mine Bounty.
  2. Go to the Man-Eater's Grotto.
  3. Move forward into the dungeon and drop to the lower level.
  4. Head left and then immediately right.
  5. Keep following the path forward without turning till you see a slope going upward.
  6. Take a left into the narrow opening at the top of the slope and head to the immediate right.
  7. Crawl through the tunnel and find the chest containing the relic.

Relic Search - Dregs of Destiny

Gypsum Cube

Tomb of Lament in Port Brilehaven

  1. Start the 'Superior Scrimshaw' quest.
  2. Enter the Tomb of Lament and keep going forward.
  3. Turn left and keep going until you reach an open area with cells.
  4. Follow the path to the left and turn right at the end to descend to the lower level.
  5. Once descended, take the small tunnel to the right and another tunnel after that to reach the chest that contains the relic.

Relic Search - Youth's Folly

Parquet Chest

Scoundrel's Hold near the Grand Trad

  1. Start the 'Greater One-Eyed Scoundrel' bounty (unlocked after reaching Virga Island).
  2. Keep heading forward and pass through the small tunnel on the left.
  3. After exiting the tunnel, head right until the end of the path to open the chest and get the relic.

Relic Search - Engineer's Destiny

Mossy Pillar

Land of Ceremony on Virga Island

  1. Start the 'Trial of Malnova' quest.
  2. Enter the dungeon and keep following the path into the next area.
  3. Now head right and circle back up the zigzag path to enter another doorway on the right.
  4. Now go towards the left and enter the last doorway.
  5. After going forward, you'll see the chest that contains the relic.

Relic Search - Bitter Memories

Panhandled Ore

Everfrost Forest

  1. Start the "The Fiend in the Frozen Forest" bounty.
  2. Enter the Everfrost Forest and keep following the path until you fight the Icebeast Chimenzahn.
  3. After defeating the boss, keep moving forward to get the chest that contains the relic.

Relic Search - A Dream's Origin

Stitched Sphere

Mt. Vulkano

  1. Start the 'Wayward Shepherd' quest from Eupha.
  2. Enter Mt. Vulkano's Dungeon and keep heading forward in the dungeon.
  3. Keep heading towards the right until you pass an NPC and turn left to climb up a ladder.
  4. After climbing up, keep going left until you see a pit; turn right from it.
  5. Keep heading forward until you come across another pit; walk around its ledge to go into an opening to find the chest with the relic.

Relic Search - Petty Thief

Track down the Relic Thief Jin

Jin's Gauntlet Runner headed to the abandoned Nord Mine

  1. Talk to the Guard in front of the recruitment center in Grand Trad.
  2. Travel to Jin's location marked on the map.
  3. Defeat him in battle to finish the quest and retrieve the last relic.

That's how to complete each of Neuras' quests in Metaphor: ReFantazio . This will help you unlock the level 8 follower bond for Neuras and gain access to his Elite Gunner Archetype.

item.title: Black Ops 6: Best Secondary Weapons, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Black Ops 6 loadouts need well-selected secondary weapons for strategic advantage.
  • Choose the right secondary weapon to complement playstyle and situation for victory.
  • Use pistols like Grekhova or GS45 for effective close to mid-range engagements.

Building the perfect loadout in Black Ops 6 often starts with selecting the strongest primary weapons and perks, but secondary weapons are just as crucial for a balanced approach. These options aren't just back-up; they provide players with unique strategic advantages, especially in tight scenarios where primary weapons might just fall short.

With only one secondary slot to fill and six weapons to pick from (two of which being launchers), it's vital that players have the right gun equipped to best suit their playstyle. Each one has its own strengths and weaknesses, so understanding which situations might call for certain weapons can be the difference between winning and losing.

6 HE-1

A Free-Firing, High-Explosive Rocket Launcher

  • Base Mags: 3
  • Base Mag Size: 1
  • Unlock Level: 19

The powerhouse of Black Ops 6 is without a doubt the HE-1 Launcher. This weapon excels at destruction and is best suited to blowing up enemy equipment and Scorestreaks. However, it's important to note that the launcher has no locking-on capabilities, so players will need to rely on their own manual aiming to have any chance of shooting an enemy UAV out of the sky.

Despite its explosive promise, it can be surprisingly weak against enemy targets, as a direct rocket is not guaranteed as a kill. Instead, players will need to use the launcher cleverly, such as in high traffic areas or enemy-secured portions of the map. Partner the secondary with an Assault Pack to re-fill on rockets occasionally, and the explosions should show no signs of slowing down.

5 9mm PM

Reliable Backup For Fast-Paced Encounters

  • Base Mags: 3
  • Base Mag Size: 10
  • Unlock Level: Immediate

The starting pistol is as reliable as ever this year round, as the 9mm PM partners a high rate-of-fire with manageable recoil to produce a well-rounded secondary option. It's ideal for finishing off opponents or engaging in close-quarter combat when a primary weapon isn't immediately available, typically because it ran out of ammo mid-gunfight.

Its accuracy and ease-of-control allows players to confidently switch to the PM without sacrificing precision, though its damage-per-shot is slightly lower than other available sidearms. If relied on too heavily, players can easily get outgunned by stronger pistols and most primaries. Ultimately, it shines as a reliable secondary to get players out of a pinch, but it should be paired with a robust primary for the best results.

4 CIGMA 2B

Perfect Scorestreak Denial

  • Base Mags: 2
  • Base Mag Size: 1
  • Unlock Level: Immediate

A Scorestreak's worst nightmare is a homing missile, and with the CIGMA 2B equipped, players can rain on their enemy's parade with ease. Though it's more of a specialist weapon, the launcher suits those who like to focus on anti-vehicle and scorestreak operations. So long as players are careful during the locking-on process, they should face little resistance to destroying enemy aircraft.

Naturally, any loadout opting for a rocket launcher as its secondary requires players to rely heavily on their primary weapon during the majority of the match, as the rockets won't be as effective on the ground thanks to their slower draw and reload speed. It's definitely a situational pick, but it's incredibly consistent in what it does.

3 Stryder .22

Trading Power For Speed

  • Base Mags: 2
  • Base Mag Size: 30
  • Unlock Level: 40

Players looking for a nimble secondary should look no further than the Stryder .22 pistol; it's widely favored for its large magazine, which is ideal for rapid gunfights or multiple encounters in quick succession. High handling stats also make it easy to switch to and from, further adding to its dependability.

What it has in speed and handling it unfortunately lacks in firepower, which explains the higher magazine size. Quick, successive shots need to be landed on enemies to reliably kill them, but if players are facing foes directly with any other primary or secondary, it's highly likely they'll get outgunned. Ideally, this pistol is used to either finish enemies off or catch them by surprise when they think the player's out of bullets.

2 GS45

A Pistol That Packs A Punch

  • Base Mags: 3
  • Base Mag Size: 10
  • Unlock Level: 28

No other pistol offers as great a firepower than the GS45, and for that reason alone, it's one of the best secondary options in Black Ops 6 . With such a quick time-to-kill, it'll only take a few shots for players to drop an enemy, though it needs to be at a reasonable distance, as the damage drops off fairly quickly.

Perhaps one of the best benefits to equipping a pistol is the added maneuverability players get. Partner this with the new omnimovement system, and players can zoom through maps at a blistering pace, all whilst taking shots with such a powerful sidearm.

1 Grekhova

A Secondary As Good As A Primary

  • Base Mags: 3
  • Base Mag Size: 20
  • Unlock Level: 13

The Grekhova pistol is widely regarded as the best secondary weapon in Black Ops 6 , thanks to its fully automatic fire rate and impressive accuracy for such a fast-firing pistol. It's exceptional in close to mid-range encounters, and it can even outgun plenty of primary heavyhitters in the right circumstances.

What truly sets it apart, though, is its accuracy. It experiences very little recoil, especially when it's partnered with a weighted stock, which can transform it into a surprisingly accurate hip-fired machine. The combination of speed and precision makes it a formidable choice for anyone with an aggressive playstyle, and if the right perks are partnered with it, then players can build a loadout ready to dominate any online lobby.

item.title: Eternal Return: Best Tanks, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Tanks in Eternal Return focus on disrupting enemies with unique abilities and high survivability.
  • Low pick rates don't diminish the impact of tanks like Elena and Lenox who excel in crowd control and true damage.
  • Health regeneration, crowd control, and damage mitigation are key traits of top tanks like Eleven and Garnet in Eternal Return.

What makes a good tank in a MOBA? A tank's job is to attract attention and attacks, commonly referred to as "drawing aggro", while making sure they are alive long enough for the rest of their team to be able to achieve their class' goals. Many people consider Tanks to be a leader of sorts since they are the ones to truly set the pace of an encounter. They sacrifice damage in exchange for a high health pool, and even those without a high health pool can get by with the help of a support unit.

Eternal Return is different when it's compared to other popular MOBAs since it has more in common with games like Fortnite than it does with League of Legends . However, it is still a MOBA at its core, and the things that make tanks great in MOBAs are still very present in the best tanks of Eternal Return.

10 Whip Mai

Win Rate % - 14.76%

  • TOP 3 % - 41.46%
  • Pick Rate % - 0.80%

When discussing the best characters in a competitive game, it is important to understand how a character's pick rate and win rate correlate with each other. Yes, Whip Mai is only picked less than 1% of the time, but when referring to the best characters in Eternal Return, there are only a few select characters that fit the description. In addition to that, all the tanks in this title have low pick rates. The better picks will have a much higher pick rate, relatively speaking, but the more people playing a certain character means there will be more players losing with them as well.

Those who dedicate the time to learning Mai have the advantage of game knowledge. Since she doesn't pop up much in a match, many players might not know what she does. She's a tank whose abilities scale with her defense stat and her skills have great synergies with each other, allowing her to increase her damage while also protecting her teammates with shields.

9 Axe Estelle

Win Rate % - 14.12%

  • TOP 3 % - 40.88%
  • Pick Rate % - 1.31%

Estelle's tankiness comes from her health regeneration passive, whereas other tanks employ high defenses to mitigate damage. She opts instead to heal damage taken over time. Her second skill, "First Response", allows her to reduce the movement speed of enemies. It's good for tanks to be able to slow down advancing enemies, allowing their teammates to escape or provide more damage per second.

Estelle can disrupt foes and stay alive, but she also can pivot to more of a support role for her allies if she needs to.

8 Rapier Elena

Win Rate % - 12.66%

  • TOP 3 % - 43.24%
  • Pick Rate % - 1.37%

Elena has a unique approach to the tank role, as she is primarily used to annoy her opponents. Her skills damage targets while increasing her defensive stats. Elena also is able to reduce the cooldown of her skills as she hits her opponents with them, allowing her to wear them down over time with her survivability.

Her ultimate skill adds crowd control to her already frustrating kit allowing Elena players to ice skate all over her enemies before they can even think of counterplay.

7 Glove Alonso

Win Rate % - 14.03%

  • TOP 3 % - 37.53%
  • Pick Rate % - 1.37%

A good counter to tanks in MOBA games is crowd control. Alonso's passive skill makes him immune to immobilization effects for a brief moment and refreshes over time. While also being immune to crowd control, Alonso employs crowd control to take charge of the front line in encounters.

His magnetic abilities are not only fun to use but can easily disrupt teams making him a target players definitely want to take out quickly. This plays right into the fantasy of a tank player and, despite the increased attention from enemies, Alonso also has health sustain built into his kit, making him a solid all around.

6 Whip Lenox

Win Rate % - 14.38%

  • TOP 3 % - 40.31%
  • Pick Rate % - 1.44%

Lenox is a tank that's good against other tanks. Another good counter to tanks is true damage or damage that ignores a tank's resistances, and Lenox has true damage built into her ultimate skill.

On top of her built-in true damage, Lenox also gets access to shields and crowd control, making her a force to be reckoned with no matter who she is facing. Throwing in the ability to pull enemies closer or push them away from allies makes her a top-tier pick.

5 Axe Markus

Win Rate % - 14.38%

  • TOP 3 % - 40.31%
  • Pick Rate % - 1.44%

Disruption is a common theme when looking at the best of the best when it comes to the tank class. Markus has a lot in common with other tanks. He's good at crowd control and staying alive but he also does those things better than other tanks without straying too much from being a tank.

He's even good with other tanks since his ultimate reduces the defense of enemies hit while slowing them as well. If Markus wants to engage, players will have to deal with him but unfortunately, he's good in one-on-one situations as well.

4 Bat Darko

Win Rate % - 11.43%

  • TOP 3 % - 37.48%
  • Pick Rate % - 1.85%

Darko is interesting when compared to the other tanks in the game because of his passive which allows him to steal enemy resistances from them. Being tanky is one thing, but being able to be tanky while reducing the tankiness of other players is a great ability to have. The rest of Darko's kit features the run-of-the-mill tank abilities, including slows and shielding.

However, the ability to steal 4% of an enemy's defense for 4 seconds upon hitting them just makes him that much better than other tanks.

3 Hammer Eleven

Win Rate % - 14.94%

  • TOP 3 % - 41.25%
  • Pick Rate % - 1.87%

Eleven is similar to Estelle since they both use health regeneration as their main form of drawing attention. Eleven has both high HP and a continuous healing ability but what puts her over the edge is her ability to heal her allies.

Her true strength unlocks with her ultimate which provides so much healing that she'd be unstoppable without a proper counter. Of course, she does practically no damage so of course her survivability has to be really strong to make up for it.

2 Bat Garnet

Win Rate % - 13.45%

  • TOP 3 % - 41.25%
  • Pick Rate % - 1.87%

Garnet is a tank that gets stronger the more damage she takes. Tanks already want to be in the fray, taking as much damage as possible, so there's no surprise that she's top 2 in terms of tanks in Eternal Return . In a scenario where she is facing off against another tank, she should almost always win especially with her very strong ultimate skill, "Maiden's Embrace".

This skill deals damage upon landing and marks them for 6 seconds. If the target's HP drops below 20% during this time, then the skill can be recast and the target is executed.

1 Hammer Magnus

Win Rate % - 11.97%

  • TOP 3 % - 39.52%
  • Pick Rate % - 2.10%

The best tanks when it comes to MOBA titles are the ones that can also do a ton of damage. Eternal Return is no different, as Magnus is able to tank a lot of damage while dishing it right back out to his enemies. Every time he is hit with basic attacks his resistances increase and this stacking mechanic increases faster every time he lands a skill on an enemy.

Magnus gives the player a lot of room for skill expression so a lot of players pick him bringing his win rate down, but a good Magnus can be spotted a mile away and a great Magnus shines as the best tank in Eternal Return .

item.title: CoD: Black Ops 6 Campaign - Most Wanted Walkthough
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Complete Most Wanted In Black Ops 6 Campaign
  • How To Complete Highest Bidder In BO6 Campaign
    • Hack The Auction Computer
    • Find The Clock And Decipher The Code
    • Exchange The Diskette For Senator McKenna's Retina Photo
  • How To Complete Covert Affair In BO6 Campaign
    • Pick The Valet Card
    • Grab The Envelope
    • Exchange The Envelope For Senator McKenna's Retina Photo
  • How To Complete Mystery Man In BO6 Campaign
    • Find The Note Inside The Senator's Coat
    • Locate Grisham And Steal His Device
    • Infiltrate The Meeting And Take Senator McKenna's Retina Photo
    • Climb To The Terrace
    • Make Your Way Through Enemies
    • Clean Your Escape Route

Most Wanted is the fifth mission in the Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 campaign, where players must infiltrate an elite political fundraiser event at Washington D.C.s Capitol Station to rescue Russell Adler from a hidden CIA Black Site below.

In this mission, players have three different methods to complete the objective, each varying in difficulty and requiring careful stealth to avoid detection by guards. Below is a complete level walkthrough, detailing each step and solution to ensure successful infiltration and extraction.

How To Complete Most Wanted In Black Ops 6 Campaign

In the Most Wanted mission, players will step into the role of Case, tasked with infiltrating the high-profile fundraiser to capture Senators McKenna retinal scan, allowing access to the secure Black Site where Adler is held captive. To achieve this, players can choose from three distinct approaches, each involving entry into restricted, guard-monitored areas.

The result of all three choices will be the same.

How To Complete Highest Bidder In BO6 Campaign

To complete the Highest Bidder quest in BO6 's Campaign, you'll first need to select the mission on the map that Sev will give you once you manage to take the photo of the senator. Next, you'll need to speak to Gabriel Armato , a fixer for New York's crime families who will give you a task to complete in exchange for Senator McKenna's retina photo .

Hack The Auction Computer

Head to the location marked on the map and carefully enter through the yellow curtains keep in mind that you'll be in a restricted area upon entering; if any guards spot you, you'll alert security. Enter the room, stealthily take down the enemy, and hack the action computer with the code 'MCKENNA. '

Find The Clock And Decipher The Code

Next, head to the auction hall to find the clock. To do so, you'll need to take the path on the left as you enter and carefully make your way to the end without being spotted by the guard. Try to get into one of the yellow curtains to be able to take down the enemy without him seeing you. Alternatively, you can also take him down and hide him inside the curtains so that no one finds him.

Once you reach the end, enter the curtains on your left, and as soon as you come out a few steps away, there will be the clock. Interact to find and access the code. To complete the code you will need to turn on the blacklight and find the fingerprints on the numbers . Here you will have to try the numbers marked to find the code the colors and symbols will guide you to enter the correct one. Green means that the number is correct and is placed in the correct game, yellow means that the number is correct but is located somewhere else, and red means that the number is not included in the sequence.

Exchange The Diskette For Senator McKenna's Retina Photo

When you have the diskette inside the clock, take it to Armato , who will give you a location where you can take a photo of Senator McKenna's retina. From here you will only have to go to the location marked on the map and carefully sneak until you reach the end of the hallway without being detected. Knock on the door of the room, enter, and take a photo of the senator's retina.

How To Complete Covert Affair In BO6 Campaign

To complete the Covert Affair quest in BO6 's Campaign, you'll need to speak to McKenna's wife, who will exchange a photo of the Senator to cover the affair with his aide, Mrs. Johannsson.

Pick The Valet Card

After talking with McKenna's wife, head to the auction hall to hear Mrs. Johannsson's blackmail conversation. Next, you'll need to pickpocket the valet card to access the envelope with McKenna's explicit content inside the car. To do this, wait for the security guard to move away from the door, enter the restricted area, stand behind him, and steal the card.

Grab The Envelope

Head outside the Capitol and give him the card in the valet area in exchange for the car key. Open the trunk and pick up the envelope with the images and the recording for the blackmail and deal with the owner of the car. After completing this, CIA security will be on alert, so you'll need to carefully enter the Capitol again , just make sure no guards spot you in the parking lot.

Exchange The Envelope For Senator McKenna's Retina Photo

Once you're inside, head over to McKenna's wife and inform her of the situation , ask for the picture, and head back to the auction hall to confront Mrs. Johannsson while the wife arrives. Once McKenna's wife deals with her husband's aid, give her the envelope with the information, and in exchange, you'll be able to take a retina shot of the senator.

How To Complete Mystery Man In BO6 Campaign

To complete the Mystery Man quest in BO6 's Campaign, you'll need to find a note in Senate McKenna's coat, find the man he'll have a secret, private meeting with, and infiltrate him to get the photo by force.

Find The Note Inside The Senator's Coat

To do this, you'll first have to go to the Coat Check by entering through the yellow curtain. Just wait for the guard to advance and slip through the gap in the red tape on the side. When you enter the Coat Check, turn left, and at the end of the last coat rack, you'll find the Senator's coat with the note that will reveal the mysterious man: Grisham.

Locate Grisham And Steal His Device

Head to the dance floor, and on the left side will be Grisham (wearing a white tuxedo and black glasses). Just take a photo of him to confirm his identity. Sneak through the area restricted by the yellow curtains until you reach the room where Grisham is, and eliminate him. Pick up the device that will reveal the location of the meeting.

Infiltrate The Meeting And Take Senator McKenna's Retina Photo

Go through the curtains again to the room where the senator is, answer his questions, and defend yourself from the attack of his bodyguards. Once you have defeated them, take a photo of the senator's retina.

Climb To The Terrace

After completing any of the quests, head to the terrace to access the Black Site where Adler is being held . Inside the secure area, enter the access door and sneak onto the terrace without alerting the guards. Attempting to open the elevator door will trigger an encounter, but your teammates Sev and Marshall intervene, allowing you to descend to the Black Site.

Upon arrival, youll find that Pantheon forces have already breached the site, also seeking Adler. To navigate the area undetected , crouch and stick to the right side, avoiding enemy contact as you move to your objective. At the final door, complete a new code puzzle using the blacklight. This time, enter a four-digit sequence: Green indicates the correct number and position, yellow is correct but in the wrong spot, and red is not in the sequence.

Make Your Way Through Enemies

Once through, stealth is no longer an option; eliminate the enemies until you reach the Systems door , locked by an armored panel. You'll need to use the small drone to unlock it by carefully maneuvering under shelves. Inside, youll find Adler release him and prepare to escape by eliminating enemies. Once you reach the Juggernaut, use a Homing Knife to easily take him down.

Clean Your Escape Route

Follow the escape route through the elevator sector, bypassing blocked paths. In the main hall, avoid harming civilians as you clear enemies to reach the auction hall, where the team will grab the motorcycles as a last resort escape route. Fend off pursuers as you race to the getaway vehicle.

item.title: One Piece Bounty Rush: Best Defender Characters
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Defender characters in One Piece Bounty Rush aim to protect treasure and control the battlefield efficiently.
  • The best defenders, like Garp, S-Snake, and Kaido, offer unique abilities to withstand attacks and secure victory for their team.
  • Expertly playing defenders like Broggy, Marshall, and Olin involves strategic positioning, patient gameplay, and smart ability usage.

Protecting treasure and controlling the battlefield are the two main purposes of the defender characters in One Piece Bounty Rush . They must be able to absorb lots of damage and hold off attackers that are trying to capture another team's treasure. But holding such a strong position will take a lot of durability and smart play.

The best defenders in One Piece Bounty Rush include characters who can effectively control the treasure area while synergizing and complementing other classes on their team. Defender players will need to be patient and not move too much unless the situation requires it, being able to sacrifice their HP for the sake of the team's victory.

10 Monkey D. Garp

Best Counter Against Captains

  • HP: 9,754
  • ATK: 2,119
  • DEF: 2,292

Garp, Hero of the Navy, is specifically designed to deal with Captain-type enemies. Every time Garp attacks a Captain player, his damage is increased by 30%, and the Captain's defense is reduced by 30%. Garp also receives 30% less damage in the area close to the enemy's treasure, as well as from boosted enemies.

On top of that, Garp has a number of different defense mechanics that allow him to reduce pressure, such as 5% HP recovery after getting hit for 45% of his max HP, as well as boost to his Stagger and Knockback resistances.

9 Sengoku

Best AOE Healer

  • HP: 9,369
  • ATK: 2,157
  • DEF: 2,350

When Sengoku uses his second skill, it creates a special trait area, where he and his allies can enter and recover 25% of their HP. Also, while staying in this trait area, all defense stats are increased by 30%. This makes Sengoku an excellent healer for any team, especially taking into account that each time his team loses a treasure, his speed of movement gains a 20% bonus.

Sengoku is also immune to the Stagger effect when being downed, while his Shockwave ability can inflict AOE Stun and Knockback effects on enemies.

8 Broggy The Red

Best Defender For Perfect Guarding

  • HP: 10,380
  • ATK: 1,939
  • DEF: 2,333

Each time Broggy performs a Perfect Guard, his HP is recovered by 30%, and his cooldown times are reduced by 50%. This, in addition to his gargantuan HP pool, makes Broggy a truly formidable tank who can absorb a massive amount of damage for his team.

Additionally, if Broggy gets attacked by an enemy with a lower HP than that of his own, then he recovers 3% of his HP. If his HP is above the 50% threshold, he can ignore the enemies and refill the treasure gauge anyway.

7 Zephyr

Best Counter Against Power Users

  • HP: 9,664
  • ATK: 1,972
  • DEF: 2,516

Zephyr has special synergy with Power User enemies, allowing him to deal an extra 30% damage to them. If he receives any type of upgrade, all the incoming damage he receives will be reduced by 50%, and all negative status effects will be nullified. More so, if Zephyr performs a successful knockback on an enemy, he restores 15% of his HP.

One of the coolest things about Zephyr is that he automatically reduces cooldown times by 5% every time he's being attacked. This effect also applies each time he's being downed.

6 S-Snake

Top Defender Against Runners

  • HP: 9,662
  • ATK: 2,042
  • DEF: 2,447

S-Snake has a surprisingly high attack stat for a defender class, but her biggest selling point is the ability to instantly travel to her team's furthest treasure. This allows her to immediately react to any threat that poses her team's victory, allowing her to refill the treasure gauge despite the presence of the enemies.

S-Snake also deals extra damage to Runner enemies while using her Love-Love Mellow skill. This attack ignores all damage reduction boosts on enemies and makes her temporarily invincible.

5 Marshall D. Teech

Top Defender For Taunting

  • HP: 9,662
  • ATK: 2,042
  • DEF: 2,447

Marshall has a unique Black Vortex skill, which not only taunts enemies, luring them to his position, but also increases his damage against Power Users by 30% and restricts the enemies from dodging his attacks. This pirate is also completely immune to the Sleep status effect, which makes him practically unstoppable.

Besides that, Marshall players should focus on dealing with as many knockouts as possible, as in that case, he reduces his cooldown times by 30% and recovers his HP by 15%.

4 Olin The Oiran

Best Defender For Debuffs

  • HP: 9,522
  • ATK: 2,039
  • DEF: 2,503

The Battle of Monsters on Onigashima version of Olin, one of the Big Moms, is a multi-class character who can be either a defender or a runner, depending on the circumstances. As a defender, Olin's best trait is the ability to increase the treasure gauge by 50%, making it harder for enemies to claim her team's treasure.

Olin's Heavenly Bon-Bons skill allows her to reduce the speed of the enemy's movement, further complicating the task of capturing her team's treasure. On top of that, she can debuff the enemy's dodging ability and cooldown mechanics.

3 Edward Newgate (Great Pirate)

Best Treasure Defender

  • HP: 9,431
  • ATK: 2,050
  • DEF: 2,515

When Edward's team's treasure is being captured, he can pull off a powerful AOE attack with a Tremor status effect. This skill is so powerful that it pretty much ignores all enemy defense stats, effectively removing all opponents from his team's treasure. Similarly, he can apply the Out Of My Way skill to protect enemy treasure that's been captured by his team.

If there's a need to guarantee that no enemy can enter captured treasure, he can create a shield, which not only stops enemy attacks but also their movements.

2 Kaido

Most Overpowered Defender

  • HP: 9,471
  • ATK: 2,145
  • DEF: 2,428

In One Piece Bounty Rush , Kaido, also referred to as The Strongest Creature Alive, is incredibly strong and possesses the greatest attack power of any defense character. He obtains a large boost to his attacks and double charges, making him particularly effective against the Kozuki Clan enemies.

If Kaido enters a treasure area, all enemies attempting to do the same will be automatically set on fire. However, it's important to note that he may lose as much as 30% of his speed of movement when using this skill.

1 Luffy Gear Five

Top Multi-Class Defender

  • HP: 9,524
  • ATK: 2,010
  • DEF: 2,550

The Gear Five version of Luffy has access to all three classes in the game, including defender, attacker, and runner. But he's best only as a defender due to his ability to reduce incoming damage by 30% and gain status effect resistances when staying in the treasure area.

But most importantly, he has not two skills, like most other characters, but three, including Gum-Gum Giant, which is an even larger version of his gun. His most powerful skill is Gum-Gum Lightning, which applies Shock to all affected enemies and ignores any and all obstacles, which makes Luffy Gear Five an unstoppable force in One Piece Bounty Rush .
